Maybe, to come back to today's situation, as 
David [Lega] said, it's now more difficult to

speak about the situation of hostages families, 
and we also see – this is a painful question to

ask but... – we also see now mounting the denial 
in Western countries, in European countries,

about what happened on the 7th of October. We 
already have people denying the fact that this was

a terrorist attack and what we are now seeing is 
people in European capitals tearing posters with

the images of hostages on it, under the pretext 
that the situation in the Gaza Strip is terrible.

There is a will to destroy the very memory of the 
people who are now being kept in custody... What

kind of answer would you give to these people, who 
are now trying to make invisible the situation of

your loved ones, and trying to deny the fact that 
what is now currently continuing to happen is of

course a terrorist situation under which innocent 
civilian lives are being threatened and retained?

In two words, to those people: educate 
yourselves. Because those comments,

those chants, the Reaping of the posters... Those 
are uneducated people who got indoctrinated into

hating Israel without reason. 90% of them I'm sure 
have never visited the country, and all they know

is from the social media which is the worst kind 
of way to learn something. So I'm telling them:

educate yourselves, come and visit Israel, learn 
about the history, open a textbook. Not Tik Tok

videos. A textbook. And read about the history: 
this region is complicated. We are not telling

that everything is paradise and flowers and peace 
and so on. But visit Israel, educate yourselves,

speak to persons who've been there on October 
7. And then if you are still against us,

then there is no hope for you, you will hate 
Jews, you are anti-semitic. But for those who

are just uneducated: please do a research, 
educate yourselves... And not from Tik Tok.

I'd like to add... In this region, we all believed 
in coexistence. We all believed in peace, that we

can live together... for many years. In our family 
business, four workers from Gaza were supposed to

start working with us, on the 8th of October...
